Package org.forgerock.openam.utils

Class PerThreadCipherProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.forgerock.openam.utils.PerThreadCipherProvider
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CipherProvider
    public class PerThreadCipherProvider
extends Object
implements CipherProvider
    A CipherProvider that caches ciphers in per-thread storage. To avoid using an actual thread-local (and polluting any thread pools that may touch this), we instead maintain our own map from thread id to cipher instances. As this is just a normal (concurrent) map, then it can be garbage collected as normal so there is no memory leak on hot-redeploy.
    Since:
    12.0.0

      Initialises the thread-local cipher cache, delegating to the supplied cipher provider for actual ciphers.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PerThreadCipherProvider

        public PerThreadCipherProvider​(CipherProvider delegate,
                               int maxSize)
        Initialises the thread-local cipher cache, delegating to the supplied cipher provider for actual ciphers.
        Parameters:
        delegate - the non-null provider to get ciphers from.
        maxSize - the maximum size of the thread-local cache.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the delegate is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if maxSize is not a positive integer (> 0).

      • PerThreadCipherProvider

        public PerThreadCipherProvider​(CipherProvider delegate)
        Constructs a new PerThreadCipherProvider instance.
        Parameters:
        delegate - The CipherProvider delegate.

    • Method Detail

      • getCipher

        public Cipher getCipher()
        Gets a cipher from the thread-local storage, initialising to the delegate cipher provider if not already initialised for this thread. Returns a cipher from the underlying mechanism. The algorithm, padding, and provider used by the cipher are determined by the underlying CipherProvider implementation. The caller should call Cipher.init(int, java.security.Key, java.security.AlgorithmParameters) before making use of the cipher to ensure it is properly initialised.
        Specified by:
        getCipher in interface CipherProvider
        Returns:
        a cipher instance for this thread. May be null.
